title: ‘Washington Post’ Loses 250,000 Subscribers Over Decision To End Presidential Endorsements
description: More than 250,000 Washington Post readers have canceled their subscriptions since the newspaper announced last week that it would not make an endorsement in the presidential race, with many arguing that owner Jeff Bezos made the decision to safeguard his other business interests. What do you think? The post ‘Washington Post’ Loses 250,000 Subscribers Over Decision To End Presidential Endorsements appeared first on The Onion.
author: The Onion Staff
excerpt: More than 250,000 Washington Post readers have canceled their subscriptions since the newspaper announced last week that it would not make an endorsement in the presidential race, with many arguing that owner Jeff Bezos made the decision to safeguard his other business interests. What do you think?
text: More than 250,000 Washington Post readers have canceled their subscriptions since the newspaper announced last week that it would not make an endorsement in the presidential race, with many arguing that owner Jeff Bezos made the decision to safeguard his other business interests. What do you think? “Nothing a few hundred layoffs won’t fix.” Simon Benno, Seat Filler “Who am I to tell a billionaire how to influence world events?” Lizzy Boyett, Baby Namer “And on top of everything else, they don’t even have Wordle.” Chase Conatser, Noise Appraiser
html:
More than 250,000 Washington Post readers have canceled their subscriptions since the newspaper announced last week that it would not make an endorsement in the presidential race, with many arguing that owner Jeff Bezos made the decision to safeguard his other business interests. What do you think?

“Nothing a few hundred layoffs won’t fix.”

Simon Benno, Seat Filler

“Who am I to tell a billionaire how to influence world events?”

Lizzy Boyett, Baby Namer

“And on top of everything else, they don’t even have Wordle.”

Chase Conatser, Noise Appraiser
